title: Nifty: Erupting New Hurdles May Trigger Sell Off Any Time
text:
On analysis of the , in different time frames, I find that recent hurdles in Sino-U.S. Tariff Trade Deal may result in heavy sell-off in Asian equity markets; Nifty may lead this sell-off being at the peak level which it attained amid growing hopes of new sops for Indian equity markets in upcoming budget or even before the budget. No doubt that the Nifty 50 showed a bouncing move on Tuesday amid growing expectation of easing measures, and once again experience another upward move up to the levels of 11,883.90 before moving down at the current levels; looks evident enough to show the extension of exhaustion which may turn in a heavy sell-off bout.

I find that the Beijing's refusal to spell out farm buys may create a big hurdle in upcoming final resolution to sign a partial deal in mid of November 2019; which has already been at the verge of further delay; which capped the bullish sentiments in U.S. equity markets on Tuesday.

I expressed my doubts over the may extend bearishness; because this Sino-U.S. tariff trade tussle has already damaged most of the economies of the world. No doubt that may continue to hurt the Indian economy beyond all limits. No doubt that India’s Finance Minister Mrs. Nirmala Sitharaman and the Prime Minister Mr. Narendra Modi has been constantly applying their best possible strategies, but the changing saga of delayed deals looks continue to extend bearishness in Indian equity markets.
